content:
Following the Empress's visit to the forest moon and the widely-publicized photo op of her relaxing in the hot springs with the elderly retired alphas, there was a significant increase in public awareness and support for the conservation efforts on the moon. As a result, donations and grants from various sources, including private individuals, corporations, and non-governmental organizations, began pouring in to support the ongoing work of the Kodian Frontier Rangers and the Frontier Service.

The influx of funding allowed the Frontier Service to expand its operations and invest in new technologies and resources, further improving their ability to protect the delicate ecosystems and the unique species living on the forest moon. In addition, the increased public awareness led to a greater understanding of the importance of conservation efforts and the critical role played by the Rangers in preserving the natural beauty and biodiversity of the forest moon.

The Empress's visit also inspired more people to become involved in conservation initiatives, both on the forest moon and elsewhere in the empire. As a result, more volunteers joined the ranks of the Kodian Frontier Rangers and other conservation organizations, helping to ensure the long-term sustainability of these crucial efforts. Overall, the Empress's visit had a profound and lasting impact on the conservation movement and the protection of the forest moon's unique environment and inhabitants.
